ResourceHeader.Description: Defense Meteorological Satellite Program, DMSP-F17 17th flight unit of the DMSP Block 5D series, 3rd of the Block 5D-3 series. Main missions: cloud imagery and microwave imaging/temperature/humidity sounding. Substantial contribution to Space weather. Each DMSP satellite has a 101 minute, sun-synchronous near-polar orbit at an altitude of 830km above the surface of the earth. The local time nodes for DMSP F17 are 17:34 and 05:34. Satellite reassigned as primary operational following the loss of DMSP-19 in Feb 2016.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: DMSP Data Manager, NOAA National Environmental Satellite, Data, and Information Service, NESDIS

InformationURL.Description: Defense Meteorological Satellite Program, DMSP-F17, Information and Details

InformationURL.Name: Defense Meteorological Satellite Program, Block 5D-3 Spacecraft Overview
InformationURL.Description: Detailed information on the Defense Meteorological Satellite Program 5D-3 satellite series.

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: DMSP/F17, SESS Special Sensor Ultraviolet Spectrographic Imager, SESS/SSULI
ResourceHeader.Description: DMSP/F17, SESS Special Sensor Ultraviolet Spectrographic Imager, SESS/SSULI, The SUSLI provides Observations of the Extreme and Far UV radiation (vertical profiles) from the Earth's limb. Spectrograph for observation of Far UV and Extreme UV in the spectral range 80-170 nm inclusive of the H Lyman-alpha line at 121.6 nm, with 1.5 nm resolution, stemming from atomic oxygen and nitrogen, and molecular nitrogen, resulting in direct measurements of the electron density vertical profile as well as ion and neutral densities.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: DMSP Data Manager, NOAA National Environmental Satellite, Data, and Information Service, NESDIS

InformationURL.Name: SESS Special Sensor Ultraviolet Spectrographic Imager Web Site
InformationURL.Description: SESS Special Sensor Ultraviolet Spectrographic Imager, SESS/SSULI, Information and Details

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: DMSP/F17, SESS Special Sensor Ionospheric Plasma Drift/Scintillation Monitor-3, SESS/SSI/ES-3
ResourceHeader.Description: DMSP/F17, SESS Special Sensor Ionospheric Plasma Drift/Scintillation Monitor-3, SESS/SSI/ES-3, The SSI/ES measures the ambient electron density and temperatures, ambient ion density, the average ion temperature and molecular weight, the plasma drift and scintillation at the DMSP orbital altitude.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: DMSP Data Manager, NOAA National Environmental Satellite, Data, and Information Service, NESDIS

ResourceHeader.Description: DMSP/F17, Special Sensor Magnetometer, SESS/SSM-Boom, The SSM, a triaxial fluxgate magnetometer, measures geomagnetic fluctuations associated with geophysical phenomena.

ResourceHeader.Description: DMSP/F17, SESS Special Sensor Ultraviolet Limb Imager, SESS/SSUSI, The SUSSI provides Observations of the Extreme and Far UV radiation (vertical profiles) from the Earth's limb. Spectrograph for observation of Far UV and Extreme UV in the spectral range 80-170 nm inclusive of the H Lyman-alpha line at 121.6 nm, with 1.5 nm resolution, stemming from atomic oxygen and nitrogen, and molecular nitrogen, resulting in direct measurements of the electron density vertical profile as well as ion and neutral densities.

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: DMSP/F17, SESS Special Sensor Precipitating Electron and Ion Spectrometer 5, SESS/SSJ5
ResourceHeader.Description: DMSP/F17, SESS Special Sensor Precipitating Electron and Ion Spectrometer 5, SESS/SSJ5, The SSJ5 measures the transfer energy, mass, and momentum through the magnetosphere-ionosphere in the Earth's magnetic field. The SSJ/4 sensor consists of four electrostatic analyzers that record the flux of precipitating ions or electrons at 20 fixed energy channels between 50 eV and 30 keV.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: DMSP Data Manager, NOAA National Environmental Satellite, Data, and Information Service, NESDIS

InformationURL.Name: SESS Special Sensor Precipitating Electron and Ion Spectrometer 5 Web Site
InformationURL.Description: SESS Special Sensor Precipitating Electron and Ion Spectrometer 5, SESS/SSJ5, Information and Details

ResourceHeader.Description: DMSP_5D3-F17 spacecraft positions in various coordinate systems

DMSP/F17, Operational Linescan System, OLS, The OLS measures visible (0.4-1.1 micrometers) and infrared (10.25-12.6 micrometers) wavelengths to provide day and night cloud cover imagery. The satellite measures data at a 0.56 km resolution, which is averaged on board, to produce global coverage at 2.7 km resolution. All of the 2.7 km resolution (smooth) data is downlinked to the ground sites while a small amount of the 0.56 km resolution (fine) data is stored and downlinked. The OLS is the primary sensor on each DMSP satellite.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: DMSP Data Manager, NOAA National Environmental Satellite, Data, and Information Service, NESDIS

InformationURL.Name: Operational Linescan System Web Site

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: DMSP/F17, Special Sensor Microwave Imager/Sounder, SSMIS
ResourceHeader.Description: DMSP/F17, Special Sensor Microwave Imager/Sounder, SSMIS, The SSMIS provides Multi-purpose imagery with temperature/humidity sounding channels for improved precipitation, 21 frequencies, 24 channels MW radiometer covering the 54 and 183 GHz bands.
